name: The New Ellington

reviews.text: Stay here on a regular basis with work and I have to say after staying at many hotels in Leeds this is the best in town.
reviews.title: Simply the best in Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service, quality and attitude is second to none the restaurant beats many in London, if your coming to Leeds then you have to try this place it's taking off now and I have booked my room for the next three months as lost out a few times.
reviews.title: Nice vibe - dark rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not over priced for what you get and if you want service this is the place to be and if you want to relax after work in town this this the place to be
reviews.title: ok

reviews.text: Fun hotel - on quiet street. Biggest downside was dark, narrow room looking out over to office block just metres away. Otherwise, funky and intereting food (local hare) in restuarant. Had to work hard to get right decaff capsules for the Nespresso machine (a surprisingly common issue - even in service focused far east!)
reviews.title: dont stay anywhere else till you tray the ellington

reviews.text: booked this hotel,for a romantic break,booked the executive room,but was not convinced this is wot we got,did ask staff about it,but they assured me ,the only differance was the size of the bed,nice trendy hotel,clean,tea and coffee facilites,but only 2 teabags and two sachets of coffee,had to ask a couple of times for refills,didnt book in for breakfast,so cant commet on the food,10 minute walk into leeds,enjoyed my stay but would probably look for something else nxt time i visit
reviews.title: I had a amazing time

reviews.text: Stayed for one night as we were dining out and visiting a few bars in the city
reviews.title: Style and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at 5 pm and there was no secure parking available as it is shared with an office. There was plenty of on street parking directly outside and it was free from 6pm until 8am After 6 you are able to pay in advance until your checkout time
reviews.title: Dinner Experience Special Offer available via their website

reviews.text: There are a couple of bars nearby but they are not rowdy
reviews.title: Stay here - you won't regret it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very well styled, staff very attentive, bar area comfortable and stocked with a great selection of beers and ales
reviews.title: plush
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable, quiet and clean. Equipped with ironing board, hairdryer, trouser press and expresso maker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as you walk into the hotel you feel a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of Leeds Centre. The large Bar/Reception area is contemporary and full of style - unlike most hotels we actually decided then and there that we would be back for drinks that evening (we don't always use hotel bars preferring to eat and drink out).
reviews.title: Central, Welcoming and very comfortable.

reviews.text: Service was very attentive throughout the stay, no problems helping with directions, booking taxis, carrying bags and when we booked an extra night last minute it was arranged that we could stay in the same room.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

reviews.text: The room itself was very large - plenty of room for a very large bed, two arm chairs, a coffee table etc. Nice touch to put a large umbrella in the wardrobe to borrow on rainy days too!
reviews.title: Promises much - but doesn't quite deliver.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nespresso machine was nice to have, and toiletries were one of my favourite brands!
reviews.title: verry niice

reviews.text: If I was going to comment negatively on anything, I would say that it was a shame the flatscreen was attached to a wall that made it difficult to watch from the armchairs, and that hot chocolate would have been nice.
reviews.title: Really fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Trendy boutique hotel situated in a lovely part of Leeds city centre. Rooms are spacious, bathrooms are clean and lush. The bar is lovely place to have a cocktail after a long day and the breakfast was delicious! Staff are friendly and accommodating, would definately pay extra for a little bit of luxury.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with a personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. The Wife and I , Son and his Partner. We booked the two suites and were not disapointed. Spotlessly clean huge rooms with all the extras one would expect when upgrading to a suite. Bathrooms a little on the small side but fine. Great comfy beds !
reviews.title: Well done The New Ellington.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was really good, just ask for your choice and they will cook it for you fresh and tasty. We ate out on the evening but the restaurant looked really busy and the menu looked interesting. Will book in for this on our next visit.
reviews.title: a great break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff we met were all very friendly and professional, please keep up the good work!
reviews.title: Truly outstanding in every way!

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of meeting Tom Wheatley , operations manager, who was working on the bar with another enthusiastic friendly bar tender. Great cocktails guys ! Made us feel very welcome and helpful with directions for our planed night out in Leeds.
reviews.title: Great food, great staff but a little noisy at night.

description: The New Ellington Leeds nestles amongst a row of Georgian buildings in the heart of the financial district of Leeds. Through its doors you will find distinguished and discreet personalised service. You’ll find our decor sleek, stylish and warm and our facilities offer the height of functionality. Once inside you will not want to leave.Location is second to none, with culture and posh shopping all moments away from The New Ellington – but amidst the bustle of commerce and the vibrant nightlife, The New Ellington is a haven of serenity. A luxury boutique hotel par excellence -expect Egyptian cotton bed linen, luxury toiletries, comfortable beds, 24 hours in-room dinning, cocktails to die for and a restaurant spearheaded by renowned Yorkshire chef Andrew Brookes. Our guestrooms are immensely comfortable, uncluttered and equipped with state of the art technology, complimentary wireless and hard-wired Internet access, entertainment hubs offering connection for ipods, laptop output and high-definition TV input, Nespresso coffee machines, rainforest shower heads and 32 –inch flat screen televisions complete the picture. Also available are Nintendo Wiis and Xbox 360, coupled with pre-loaded ipods with a variety of genres are available to borrow.**Please note that parking is limited and will be allocated on a first come first served basis**
